dmca.body:
_____  

From: World Guides [mailto:info@world-guides.com] 
Sent: Sunday, April 03, 2005 1:54 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Re: Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) Complaint


2ND REQUEST

Please would you update us on the situation regarding our DMCA complaint of
30/03/05 as your client's site still contains the content which has been
lifted directly from our site.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Regards

Martin

On Wednesday, March 30, 2005, at 09:56 pm, World Guides wrote:



Dear Lance Crosby, Esq. Chief Operating Officer,

It has come to our attention that a website hosted by yourselves has
breached our copyright, by taking text from OUR website, as detailed below.
Our detailed travel guides take several weeks to research and write, and we
pride ourselves on our original content. I am sure you will appreciate our
frustration to find that this original content had been completely 'lifted'
from our site without our consent.

We have contacted them twice using the email address of info@movilspain.com
on 16/03/05 and 25/3/2005, but have received no response whatsoever.
Therefore, please would you arrange for these pages to be removed from your
server, as per our offical following Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA)
Complaint.
